attributes.action: introduce legislation (THAT'S THE BIT OF WORK WE WANT HIM TO DO - IF, OF COURSE, IT IS WITHIN HIS REMIT SO TO DO?) to change the law to ensure that councils cannot undertake surveillance activity under the Regulation Of Investigatory Powers Act (RIPA) without first obtaining signed approval from a sitting High Court judge.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is becoming more obvious by the day that local councils are using this Act, which was designed to be anti-terrorism, for party political, personal and fiscal investigations.  It is wrong that somebody in a Town Hall can order the telephone records of his next door neighbour (with whom he has had a falling out) to be scrutinised and this possibility must be removed.
